fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

It would be great if users could see in the tree structure if an article is restricted or not with the red padlock logo in the title.
Administrators know their knowledge base, but how about their team? The rest of the team could be able to understand quickly which article is restricted or not with this feature.

See the image attached.

Kind regards,

!image-2020-03-24-10-23-25-887.png!
fields.summary: Copy the red padlock logo in front of the titles in the tree structure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Subscribing both Moqups for Confluence Cloud and Balsamiq Wireframes for Confluence Cloud on Confluence will break Balsamiq

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Site Admin > Find new app  
 # Install both Add-ons
#* Moqups for Confluence Cloud and 
#* Balsamiq Wireframes for Confluence

h3. Expected Results
* Able to create page via Balsamiq template and 
* Invoke Balsamiq macro via page editor

h3. Actual Results
* Error pops up on the Editor view when creating new page via Balsamiq template and
 !Screenshot 2020-03-24 at 1.29.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* Balsamiq macro isn't being invoked from the page editor
 !Screenshot 2020-03-24 at 1.31.10 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
Error rendering content for view: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (Unknown macro : mockup)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Uninstall and remove Moqups for Confluence Cloud
fields.summary: Subscribing both Moqups for Confluence Cloud and Balsamiq Wireframes for Confluence Cloud on Confluence will break Balsamiq

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a [JQL in Jira|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/guides/expand-jira/jql] using the "resolutiondate" parameter to point to the start of the day, the results are not reflected correctly in the [Jira issues macro of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html]. 

Although the user selects a timezone in https://id.atlassian.com, the number of results will only reflect the instance's timezone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have issues resolved in Jira on the current day.
# Search for these issues using a JQL like the following:
{code}
resolutiondate >= startOfDay()
{code}
# In Confluence, make sure to create a page and add the [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] using the same JQL.
# Manually change your timezone in the [Account preferences of Atlassian's ID site|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] to have it reflect a different day so it should retrieve an empty list for the JQL used in Jira.
# Refresh the Jira issues macro.

h3. Expected Results
The filter should display the number of issues based on the current timezone/day as it happens with the JQL in Jira.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence ignores the user timezone settings for the result as it does not change. A video has been recorded demonstrating the phenomenon being reproduced:
 [^Timezone_bug.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Using a JQL filter with resolution date is not reflected on Jira Issues macro

fields.description:
When uploading videos to Confluence pages, they get post-processed to produce a file preview similar to image thumbnails and the document previews for various forms of office document.

I would like to propose here that videos are either not down-sampled, or that the video player be designed such as to offer the full video resolution as an option for playback.
fields.summary: Multimedia Preview of Videos have reduced quality

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

When trying to edit the meeting note template from space settings> content tools> Meeting notes template> edit, it freezes on the loading screen.
* tried in incognito mode - no go
* tried with different browser - no go
* disabling and enabling Meeting notes Blueprint also does not help.

*Steps to Reproduce*

* Create a new space or access existing space.
* navigate to space settings>content tools> Meeting notes template> edit
* the page will freeze on load.

*Expected Results*

It should open the meeting note template, enabling editing for users.

*Actual Results*

As soon as click on Edit, the page freezes.

*Workaround*

At present we have no workaround.
fields.summary: Meeting notes template cannot be edited

fields.description:
h3.Summary
The live search macro doesn't return a search result for numeric characters, if we search for 320x50 then it will give results only for "x"

h3.Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a page with a live search macro.
2. Try to search for any numeric value.

h3.Expected Results
The Live Search Macro should return the search result for numeric values if any page contains numeric values in the title or in the page content. 

h3.Actual Results
The Live search macro doesn't return a search result for numeric characters, search results is inconsistent.

h3.Workaround
Try to search using "Search Help" > title: title of the page.
Use advanced search.
fields.summary: Live search does not search for numeric characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you create the first meeting notes on a space, Confluence will create an index page in your space sidebar after publishing the page, and all the meeting notes created in that space, using this template, will be automatically listed there. However, the 1st page will not automatically be a child of the Meeting Notes index page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space
# Create a page using meeting notes template
# Create a 2nd page using the meeting notes template

h3. Expected Results
- The 1st page published using the meeting notes template should be a child page of the Meeting Notes index page. 

h3. Actual Results
- The 1st page published using the meeting notes template was not a child page of the Meeting Notes index page. 

h3. Workaround
- Manually move the 1st meeting notes page as a child of the Meeting notes index page.
fields.summary: First Meeting Notes page was not a child of the Meeting Notes index page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Roadmap planner upon publishing repositions the bars added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Page, add the Roadmap Planner with multiple bars in weeks and publishing the page will give the roadmap planner as shown below:Expected Results

h3. Expected Results
 * Macro on the page looks like how it is when editing the macro

h3. Actual Results

[^Screen Recording 2020-03-14 at 00.21.57.mov]
h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Roadmap looks different in edit mode vs view mode

fields.description:
See: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/645846308/Quick+Wins+-+context+in+hover+states+and+dropdown]

Working on branch: perms_quick_wins

PR link: [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/pull-requests/14998/overview]
 Original ticket: [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/CCBBPERX-536]

Steps to reproduce:

None
fields.summary: Fetch permissions for each page's hover state and dropdown options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deactivating the "Autowatch" option in the Confluence settings doesn't deactivate the "Watch this page" option when adding a comment on a page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# navigate to Confluence
# click on your avatar
# select *Settings*
# click *Email*
# click *Edit* in the bottom of the page
# uncheck the box *Autowatch*
# click *Submit*
# go to a page and add a comment

h3. Expected Results
The "Watch this page" checkbox is unchecked.

h3. Actual Results
The "Watch this page" checkbox is checked.

h3. Workaround
Uncheck the box before saving the comment.
fields.summary: Deactivating the "Autowatch" option in the Confluence settings doesn't deactivate the "Watch this page" option when adding a comment on a page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When using Heading style 3 and 4, the page export will have size difference for the headings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add Heading Style 3 and 4 on a page
 * Publish the page & Export the page

h3. Expected Results
 * Both the headings will have the required size upon publishing the page and while exporting the page as PDF

h3. Actual Results
 * In the Export PDF, Heading *h3* becomes smaller than Heading *h4*

h3. Workaround
 * Use Heading 3 only or export the page in word instead of PDF
fields.summary: Header Size is different during PDF Page Export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you edit the table in the Decision template this stops the fields from auto-populating information from the fields on the page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add text to any field in the table in Decision log template (then save)
 # Attempt to create a new page utilizing the Decision template

h3. Expected Results

Fields should populate with previously entered information from the Decision Log

Successful Decision template
 !Screenshot 2020-03-19 at 20.10.14.png|width=276,height=159!
h3. Actual Results

Information is not populated and the Table is blank: 
 See Video And Screenshot
 Unsuccessful after editing the template and adding text to the table
 !Screenshot 2020-03-20 at 06.29.33.png|width=298,height=169!

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing Decision Template causes stops fields from populating
[Love Sprint 2] Improve developer /wiki/rest/api/content documentation
Getting grandchildren of a custom content with Get Content or Get Content Children By Type REST APIs returns empty list
Create Content REST API documentation is missing a 'container' body parameter
Children Display macro doesn't keep the correct formatting of a table when using Rich Content setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editor, if you're using a macro such a page properties, that has a table inside it, if you set your page editor to full width, the table inside the macro automatically adds a horizontal bar to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Insert a page properties macro and make sure to have a table on it
# Set the page to "Full width" mode by clicking on the Wide arrows
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
No scrollbar should be shown

h3. Actual Results
There's a scrollbar, independent if the table has contents on it or not.

h3. Workaround
Setting the width of the page to "fixed width" and the scroll bar should disappear.
fields.summary: New editor Tables inside a macro have a horizontal bar if the page is on full width

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When excerpting a table from a page to another one, the macro preview for the *Excerpt Include* macro shows the table in the old editor-style, though it embeds the content correctly withing the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page *Page A*;
 # Add the *Excerpt* macro and insert a table within it;
 # Publish page *Page A*;
 # Create a page *Page B*;
 # Insert the *Excerpt Include* macro and inform the page *Page A*, in the _Page Containing the Excerpt_ field;
 # Hit the *Preview* button.

h3. Expected Results

The content is shown as it is in *Page A*.
h3. Actual Results

The content is shown in the old editing style.

 

*Note*
 * As far as we could test it, it doesn't affect the content in the view mode of the page.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro previews tables in the old editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Users are no longer able to add inline comments to a table that's inside a *Page Properties* macro on the new editor (while still being able to do the same on the old editor).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page both in the new editor and the old one
 # on both add a *Page Properties macro* > add a table inside of this macro with some text;
# Publish both pages and try to add an inline comment on any table-cell;

h3. Expected Results
* User should be able to add inline comments on both pages;

h3. Actual Results
* Customer is not able to add inline comments to text inside this table on the *new editor* , while still being able to add an inline comment to the same page that is using the *old editor*


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: No longer able to add inline comments to tables on pages using the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the instance has the new navigation and homepage set on the "further configurations", it will provide both options: site homepage and default dashboard (home)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an instance with the new navigation
 # Set its homepage to be a space (Further configuration)
 # Check the navigation bar (A new option will be added, attached screenshot)

h3. Expected Results

Only the site homepage option should be visible and provided on the navigation bar.
h3. Actual Results

Both options are presented on the navigation bar.
h3. Notes

The redirection on the confluence logo works as expected to the site homepage.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The new navigation shows both dashboard and site homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Activity stream macro, setting the Jira filter show Chinese characters for options.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page,
# While in in edit mode add the activity stream macro
# Save the page.
# Put the page back in edit mode
# Edit the Activity stream macro
# Click Jira filter

h3. Expected Results
The option in the dropdown shown in English

h3. Actual Results
The options in the dropdown are all in Chinese
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the Confluence filter to determine the option position to the Jira filter
fields.summary: Activity stream macro Jira filter shows Chinese characters

fields.description:
*Suggestion: Provide apps the ability to detect when macro is in old or new page, so that the app will be able to style macros w/ stylesheet from parent page, using context parameters.*

As developers of Atlassian Connect apps we need a way to tell if the macro is in a fabric page or an old page.

We run into problems where we need to know what kind of a page the macro is being rendered in. Also, rendering iframes in macros is difficult to style because we don't have a stylesheet that matches the parent page.

For example:
 We are currently struggling to render font sizes and some subtle line rendering in frames in our macros to look good in both old and new pages and it is looking like we can make it look good in one or the other.
 (what we really need for that one is for Atlassian to provide a stylesheet to the connect macro that matches the parent page's styles so we can us it inside of iframes. )

Another example:
 There are caching bugs for fabric pages with Connect macros in them. We reported this with DEVHELP-4036. Until that is fixed we would like to render a warning in our macro editor (only for fabric/new pages).

We probably have other examples. I'm new to the Atlassian ecosystem so my explanations may be weak but my colleagues have lots of experience with it and I can consult further with them if necessary. Please let me know if this issue needs clarification.

I'm assigning a high severity to this issue because more and more of our customers are using fabric pages, especially new customers. It is difficult to sell our macros if they render poorly styled content.

Thanks!

–

Existing apps (IDs) in Marketplace that are affected:
 biz.artemissoftware.confluence.multiexcerpt.MultiExcerptMacro
 biz.artemissoftware.confluence.html.HtmlMacro

DEVHELP reference:
 [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-4037]
fields.summary: Connect context parameters that tell us which editor (legacy, fabric, etc.) was used to compose the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

“See their comment” link on a new comment flag does not link to the respective comment. Instead there have been reports of the current page refreshing or being redirected to home page

"There was page with active inline commenting ongoing. I answered one comment, and noticed a flag. I pressed see comment, and appeared on home page"
 "the link just refreshes the page, it doesn't even update the URL to highlight the new comments like i expected it would have"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User A comments on page
 # User B receives flag notifying them about new comment
 # User B clicks "See their comment" link on flag

h3. Expected Results

User B is redirected to User A's new comment on the page

 
h3. Actual Results

User B is auto-redirected to home page instead of user A's comment

OR

User B's current page is refreshed instead of navigating to user A's comment
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking “See their comment” link on a new comment flag will not redirect to comment
Roadmap Planner macro not working properly with bodied macros in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

3rd Party Add-ons stops working if default group isn't confluence-users

h3. Steps to Reproduce (example with Slack)
 # In an instance with Slack integration enabled, create a new group - *abc*
 # Grant this group the "default" status and add it to Confluence product access
 # Remove product access and default status from *confluence-users*

h3. Expected Results

Integration still works as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The below error is observed.
{quote}Something went wrong while xxxxx. Please try again later or contact support.
 Error code: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
 Error ID: xxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxx
{quote}
!image-2020-03-18-12-26-10-022.png|width=413,height=203!

This happens because the Slack Integrations user (confluence-chats-integration@connect.atlassian.com) adds itself to confluence-users and atlassian-addons. Since none of those groups are granting it product access to Confluence, it doesn't work.
h3. Workaround

Contact Support to add Slack's system user to your default group.
fields.summary: Add-ons might stop working if confluence-users group doesn't have access on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images linking to anchors are not working on Legacy Editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using Legacy Editor.
# Add an anchor to the page.
# Add an image to the page.
# Use the image as a link to the created anchor.
# Publish the page.
# Click on the image.

h3. Expected Results
The link should work and the page should be reloaded according to the anchor position.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
If you open the link on a new tab _(hold command (Mac)/ctrl (Windows) while clicking on the image)_, the new tab will load according to the anchor position.
fields.summary: Images linking to anchors are not working on the Legacy Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The suggestion list hides behind the image if the live search macro if inside the column.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
# Put live search macro in a column.
# Attach an image just below that live search macro.
# Publish the page.
# Search for something(page/content) in the live search macro.

h3. Expected Results
The suggestion list will be above the image.
 !image-2020-03-18-14-43-13-557.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The suggestion list is hiding behind the image.
 !image-2020-03-18-14-45-06-149.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Remove the live search macro from the column.
fields.summary: The suggestion list hides behind the image if the live search macro if inside the column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Seeing an error in confluence when integrating with slack

h3. Steps to Reproduce

When in Confluence, Go to space -> Space settings -> Integrations -> Slack Notifications. 

h3. Expected Results

Able to link space to Slack channel

h3. Actual Results

The user seeing the following error
{quote}
"Something went wrong while getting subscriptions list. Please try again later or contact support.
Error code: UNEXPECTED_ERROR
Error ID: 1a9b3430-53b0-11ea-897e-8d5026a11a3a"
 {quote}

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error when integrating confluence with slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding macros, there are two activity stream macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page
# Insert macro
# Select all

h3. Expected Results
Activity stream show with one option to select

h3. Actual Results
There are two options for the activity stream
 !image-2020-03-18-15-42-10-396.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate activity stream macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The user changed the Sidebar colors in Color scheme but the changes did not take place.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to settings > Color scheme
 # Change the Background, Text and icons color

h3. Expected Results

The Background, Text and icon color change according to the color we configure.


h3. Actual Results

The changes did not take place

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Colour Scheme not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When visiting pages on the iOS applications, a user will automatically like the page without the user having 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a recently visited page on the iOS app on an iPad

h3. Expected Results
Application doesn't add a like to the page since the user didn't like the page

h3. Actual Results
A like is added to the page

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mobile App Adding Like to Recently Visited Pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per [Add or Remove Page Restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/add-or-remove-page-restrictions-724764891.html] documentation.
{quote}If someone asks permission to view or edit a restricted page, we'll email the last person who edited the page and ask them to grant that permission.

If they don't have permission to change the page restrictions in that space, we'll email a space admin instead.
{quote}
However, currently, the page permission notification request is always being sent to the creator of the page and not to the person who edited the page. Even if the person who last edited the page has full permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User A to create a page
 # User A adds a restriction on the page
 # User B edited the page. User B has full permission to the page.
 # User C who does not have access to the page requested an access

h3. Expected Results
 - Email notification for page access requests should be sent to User B.

h3. Actual Results
 - Email notification for a page access request is sent to User A. However, if the User A no longer exists in the instance a message error will appear saying that it is not possible to sent the access request.

h3. Workaround
 - Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Permission Notification Request is always sent to the creator of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* While trying to editid a global template the editor keeps loading and never takes you to the actual template edit. This case could be replicated with *Customer interview reports* template.

Similar case to [CONFCLOUD-67455 - Cannot edit Status Report Template |https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67455]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Global Templates & Blueprints
 # Click to edit *Customer interview reports* template


h3. Expected Results
* Template to load so it can be edited;

h3. Actual Results
* Template loads forever while the spinning wheel keeps turning.

Checking browser's console I found an error similar to this one:
{quote}SyntaxError: "JSON.parse: unexpected character at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data"
    editorContentV2 app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    Redux 4
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    i middleware.js:25
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    Redux 2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2
    Redux 2
    a app~493df0b3.KYD5ihM2-v39.js:2{quote}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Note
This happens for the Meeting Notes template too
fields.summary: Editor won't load Global template for editing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pressing "reply" or "view link" on a resolved comment in email doesn't take user to resolved comment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Receive email related to comment
 # Resolve comment
 # Click "reply" or "view link" in email

h3. Expected Results

link will take you to the resolved comment
h3. Actual Results

link takes you to the page the resolved comment was created on, but does not actually show resolved comments
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pressing "reply" or "view link" on a resolved comment in email doesn't take user to resolved comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While previewing a Confluence page, the edit button does not work if you're not at the top of the page. The button is unclickable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Enter some content. (enough to require scrolling a few time)
# Preview the page while in edit mode
# Scroll down the page.
# Now attempt to click Edit button

h3. Expected Results
The page goes back to edit mode

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. The button is not clickable

h3. Workaround
Scroll back to the top of the page. Now the edit button should be clickable again.
fields.summary: Edit button not working during page preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Children display macro, the behavior of the scrollbar is inconsistent. It shows some time and it doesn't show other times.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the children macro to a page.
# Set the header to h2.
# Make sure there are at least four child pages with no grandchild
# The macro appears with a scrollbar
# Now add another children display macro to the page
# Set the header to h2
# Make sure that there are child and grandchild pages
# The macro appears with no scrollbar


h3. Expected Results
The macro behavior should be consistent with the scrollbar

h3. Actual Results
The macro behavior is not consistent with the scrollbar

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: children display macro scrollbar inconsistent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you use page restrictions on Confluence pages before the trial elapses and the Free tier is activated, the page restrictions cannot be removed, but continue to limit user activity. Even a site-admin cannot remove the page restrictions from the space settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test instance, and add page restrictions.
 # wait for the trial period to elapse
 # Attempt to remove the page restrictions from the page following the instructions in: [Permissions and restrictions in the free plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/permissions-and-restrictions-in-the-free-plan-976780167.html]

h3. Expected Results

The page restrictions are removed
h3. Actual Results

An error message shows up saying:

Page restrictions not removed

we couldn't remove the page restrictions from <page name>. Try Again.

The below error is returned as the response to the request:
 [{"errors":[{"message":"a0ce0ab6-3b1a-416d-a631-31129a79976d: com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Not enough permissions to clear ContentRestrictions on a content with ContentId <163917>","path":["clearRestrictionsForFree"],"extensions":\{"microsID":"a0ce0ab6-3b1a-416d-a631-31129a79976d","data":{"authorized":false,"valid":false,"errors":[{"message":{"key":null,"translation":"Not enough permissions to clear ContentRestrictions on a content with ContentId <163917>","args":[]}}],"successful":false},"statusCode":403}}],"data":null}]
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to have the page restrictions force-removed by Atlassian Support
fields.summary: It is not possible to remove Page Restrictions once Confluence changes to Free tier

fields.description:
Currently, if you access Questions for Confluence, the search box will only search for questions, not answers or comments.
h3. How to replicate the issue:
 # Access your Confluence home page.
 # Click on Apps, on the sidebar.
 # Click on Questions, on the sidebar.
 # Search for answers or comments content on the _What do you want to know?_ box.

h3. Proposed Results

The search should return answers and comments that match the search criteria.
h3. Actual Results

The search would only return questions that match the search criteria.

Workaround for answers
Use the advance search for questions and answers, comments are not searchable in advanced search.
fields.summary: Improve search box on Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when user execute a "Space export" and then go to the [Audit logs of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/audit-log-802164269.html], the user who performed the operation is displayed as "Anonymous", instead of the user that did it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open some space.
 # Open Space Settings -> Content tools -> Export.
 # Select "XML" and click "Next".
 # Select "Full export" and click "Export".
 # Wait till export finishes.
 # Open Settings of Confluence, select the *Audit Logs* option that will be on the sidebar.
 # Check the export action and the user that executed it.

h3. Expected Results

The user field should be displayed as the user who executed the action, instead of anonymous.
h3. Actual Results

"Anonymous" user displayed in Audit Log.
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Follow-up: Space export creates Audit log record with "Anonymous" user instead of actual

fields.description:
Currently we can restrict a user from creating comments by disabling his/her access to comment on the page however this disables the option to create inline comments as well.

There should be a way to restrict the inline comments separately and should not be included with the comment box at the bottom of the page.

This is very useful for revision a document, and does not hide the focus on the main document.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict inline comments
Grant site admins ability to disable collaborative editing

fields.description:
* Background*

The tasks page in your profile gives you a place to see all the tasks relevant to you. Easily keep track of the status of tasks assigned to you, and the tasks you've created and assigned to others.

In desktop to view the tasks page, the user can go to Profile > Tasks. Currently, in confluence mobile app the user does not have this option
fields.summary: My task in Mobile APP

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a comment is added to a page, all watchers will receive an email notification with the comment's contents.

Although, it would be useful to have an option to hide the comment's contents for e-mail notifications for security/ privacy reasons.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a way to hide the comment's contents in an e-mail notification.
fields.summary: Hide comment's contents from e-mail notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This is a ticket from Product Security for security requirement project Otter(https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECURITY/pages/587554708/Security+Requirements+-+OTTERs+ASDL+Practice).

We are asking teams to check for this security requirement:
Secrets must be softcoded
https://asecurityteam.atlassian.net/browse/OTTER-29


And please either create child jira ticket for each of the service your team own, or just report the compliance here in this ticket for this otter for all the services.


You can close the ticket in one of the three state:
1. Compliant and required verification has been completed, please specify the repo link.
2. Work needs to be done to be compliant, create a ticket for the work and link to this ticket and there will be SLA for the work.
3. This otter does not apply to your service, need to be verified with embedding security engineer.

Please read the above link on how to check for whether the service meet the requirement.
If you have any question regarding the ticket please contact Sparsh Raj  or Sharada Moorthy
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Manual review of code should not indicate hardcoded secrets
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results
security assistant should not have any violations from its secrets finder

h3. Actual Results
ensure the above

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Security Requirements Verification - Otter 29
Emojis are being shown as a blue star when reported via "Page Properties Report" Macro and Page History

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for a label that is similar in name to other labels. The search result dropdown is hidden by the Labels Box

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Multiple similar labels (ex. Label1, Label2, Label3, Label3.....)
 # Search for "Label"

h3. Expected Results

You should see all results that match the search string

h3. Actual Results

You will see first two or three and the rest is hidden. However, tapping down on your keyboard will let you cycle through all results.



h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Label Dialogue Box hides search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking in one link of a Table of Contents in a Confluence page, using the mobile app for Android, the user is not being redirected to the correct header. The page reloads and shows the content since the beginning like there was no click in the table of contents. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page that contains a Table of Contents using the Confluence mobile app for Android; 
# Click in any of the content links in the TOC; 
# Notice that the page will reload and will not take the user to the desired header. 

h3. Expected Results
The page should redirect to the proper header which the user clicked in the TOC.

h3. Actual Results
The page is reloading and showing its content from the top of the page

h3. Notes
* This affects both Android and iOS devices

h3. Workaround
A possible solution, in this case, would be temporarily using the Web browser.
fields.summary: Table of Contents not working properly in the Confluence Mobile app

fields.description:
As a user I want to be able to create links to specific pages in a PDF file.
h3. Problem Definition

Users are unable to add a link to PDF preview that shows the document directly in the referenced page. When attaching a preview, no matter how, users are always redirected to the first page of the document.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow users to create links to specific pages of a PDF document, almost like a summary in a document. Clicking this link, the user will open preview mode directly in the referenced page.
h3. Why This Is Important

When dealing with big documents sharing what is within them becomes a hassle because users will always start reading the document from the start.
h3. Workaround 

To implement something similar in a Confluence page, you could do the following:
 1 - Access the desired page with the PDF attached to it
 2 - Go to the *Attachment Section* (Little clip ot the right side of the padlock at the top of the page)
 3 - Click view in the desired attachment
 4 - Navigate to the desired page, the one you want to link
 5 - Right click and select *Copy image address*
 6 - Go back to the page and edit it
 7 - Paste the link you just copied
 8 - Save the page
 **Optional - Edit the pasted link name to match a desired specification
 Now, the link you pasted to the page will lead to the specified page. But, the limitations I spoke about earlier are
 - You can not navigate the entire document directly from that preview
 - When clicked, the page will open straight to the current tab, users must ctrl+click or right click and select open in another tab
fields.summary: Create Link to Specific PDF Page In Preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multiple *Pie Chart* macros are inserted on a page, only one will display properly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Macro :   !Macro.png|thumbnail! 

 # Open a new editor
 # Insert a Pie chart macro
 # Add some additional pie chart macros
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

All the pie charts will display properly.

h3. Actual Results

Only the first Pie chart will be displayed completely, the rest are not fully displayed. 

 !problem pie chart.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Use the *Jira Charts* macro instead and choose the Pie Chart option in there. 

 !JIra charts.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Multiple pie charts doesn't display properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Loading forever when a user click the button of "content report table" macro with the old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Publish a page that contains "content report table" macro
 # Click the button

Video :  [^2020-03-12 11.47.03.mov] 
h3. Expected Results
Load contents

h3. Actual Results
Loading forever

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading forever when a user click the button of "content report table" macro

fields.description:
The ability to create pages with templates such as the meeting notes and retrieve the information from the team calendars or google and O365 calendars, upon having it integrated or synched would be really useful.

It also, would be useful to have it automatically add the people invited and the agenda on the page created from the template, or have an option to populate it getting the information from the calendar.
fields.summary: Create pages based on templates and integrate it with calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for a key word that is present on a question or an answer won't return the expected results if *all content* is selected on *Type* filter. However, switching the filter to "answers" or "questions" returns the results that are expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Questions for Confluence add-on.
 # Create a question.
 # Answer the question.
 # Access advanced search.
 # Search for a key word that matches the question and/or the answer.

h3. Expected Results

As the type filter is set to *All content*, matching results should return properly.
h3. Actual Results

The search doesn't return questions and/or answers that match the search criteria.
h3. Workaround

Change the type filter to the desired one (questions or answers).
fields.summary: Advanced Search doesn't return questions or answers made on Questions for Confluence if All content is selected on Type filter

fields.description:
Currently, Users that have not logged into Atlassian and are detected as Anonymous users can try to directly access pages in a confluence instance that allows anonymous access to some pages.

When they try to directly access pages that they cannot otherwise see, then they get the error indicating that the page or space is restricted. This can be confusing for some users who expect to get access and do not notice that their little user icon is currently set to be the "login door".

I would like to propose that we trigger users who are not logged in as any Atlassian Account and try to access a Confluence page that does not otherwise allow access to anonymous users to prompt for login or otherwise indicate that the use might want to try logging in.
fields.summary: prompt anonymous users to login when accessing pages that do not allow anonymous access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * An error is thrown when adding Jira issues' dates to a Confluence Calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new instance with just Jira and Confluence.
 # Create some Jira issues with a due date (just 1 issue will do);
 # Create a new Calendar in Confluence;
 # Click *Add Event* (Event type = Jira Issue Dates) > Name the event > Under "Display" just select *Sprints*

h3. Expected Results
 * Issues to be returned normally

h3. Actual Results
 * And error is thrown to the user:
{quote}Error(s) occurred.

Unable to load events of test (6e388a84-4aee-4b6a-a769-d6828ab1f8fa): com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiraresponse
{quote}

h3. Workaround
 * As a workaround, you can remove the "Sprints" option (or the affected field) from being displayed, this would avoid this error from being thrown.
fields.summary: Error is being thrown when adding Jira issues dates to Team Calendar

fields.description: As of today, when you copy images/documents from a page to another, it is not carrying its properties (like name, labels, comments) from the original page to the new one. This is a suggestion to implement the ability to preserve the images' properties when copying them from a page to another.
fields.summary: Copying attachments from a page should keep the attachments' labels in the new page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any table copied from old editor to new editor; an extra space is added in each empty cell. This makes the overall table look taller. We need to manually remove extra space from each empty cell.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table in old editor.
 # Add some text in few cells, while leaving some of the table cells empty.
 # Copy this table to new editor

h3. Expected Results

While in edit mode in new editor the empty cells in table should not have any extra line.
h3. Actual Results

While in edit mode in new editor all the empty cells in the table gets an extra line , making the table taller in size as shown below 

!image-2020-03-11-22-51-07-993.png|width=301,height=133!
h3. Workaround

Remove the extra lines manually from each cell.
fields.summary: Empty cells of tables migrated to the new Editor have an empty line

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of March 18, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#00b8d9|titleBGColor=#00b8d9|bgColor=#f4f5f7}
Our team has released the fix to this issue to production on Wednesday March 18 PST.

Now when you go the custom color scheme settings, you can see two sections where you can customize the new top navigation colors and the old side blue (default) navigation colors separately.

Please confirm and let us know if you have further questions and feedback. Thank you for your patience.

Warm regards,
 Elaine Hankins, Confluence Cloud Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The color scheme is not reflecting when the instance has Nav 3 rollout
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # as a Confluence admin, navigate to Confluence settings
 # navigate to Color Scheme settings

h3. Expected Results

User should see correct color scheme settings with options to customize the new *top nav* experience and be able to customize color scheme successfully.
h3. Actual Results

User saw incorrect color scheme settings with options to customize the old *side nav* experience and couldn't update color scheme.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Admin has incorrect color scheme settings options when in nav3

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to edit the Create Template fields of the Decision log template. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to edit the Create Template fields of the Decision log.
fields.summary: Provide an ability to edit the Create Template fields of Decision log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- If a template has an Emojis (eg. :alarm_clock, abc, bulb, yellow star) the Emojis will turn to *blue star* when viewing the template. 
- Edit screen is displaying the Emojis properly
- Create a new page from a template will display the Emojis properly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template
# Add Emojis on the template (eg. alarm_clock, abc, bulb, yellow star)
# Save the template
# View the template

h3. Expected Results
- The Emojis should display properly when viewing the template. 

h3. Actual Results
- The Emojis will turn to *blue star* when viewing the template. 


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some Emojis are not displaying correctly when viewing a template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Infinite redirect loop occurs when a user clicks a link of inline comment with the old editor.
It occurs only when the title of the page contains Japanese and English.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that title contains Japanese and English like "アトラシアンatlassian".
 # Create an inline comment
 # Click "just a moment ago"

Video:  [^2020-03-11 12.06.28-1.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
Redirect to the comment.

h3. Actual Results
Infinite redirect loop occurs

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Infinite redirect loop when a user clicks a link of inline comment with the old editor

fields.description:
Currently, if you access a page in Confluence, even if the edit is restricted or you're accessing as an anonymous user, you cannot prevent users from being able to export the pages to PDF or any other format available.

Would be useful to have a restriction in a page level to prevent this.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent export of pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On instances that still have the legacy template *Blank page (old) (going away soon)* as well as the new *Blank page* one, it won't be possible to create pages with Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the instance with IE
# Click on *+*
# Select *Blank page* and hit *Create*

h3. Expected Results
The editor should open a new blank page

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and the following error is logged on the console:
{code:none}SCRIPT438: Object doesn't support property or method 'addTransientObserver'
batch.js (189,326){code}


h3. Workaround
 Currently the only available workaround is to use a different browser.
fields.summary: Can't create pages using internet explorer (IE 11) on instances with both editors

fields.description: Use case description: Build an integration with the customer's HR application to identify former user's who may be logging into the system or user's who haven't logged into the system in a while that may no longer need access.
fields.summary: Get last login timestamp by user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence cloud app - iOS iPAD

Collaborative editing of page in Confluence app using iOS iPad is giving issue "*A newer version of this page has been published. Copy any changes you want to keep then edit the page again.*"

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with the new editor experience
 # Try to edit the above page through Confluence app on iOS along with any other user editing same page.
 # The issue occurs while doing collaborative editing.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to edit and save the page in the app
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot edit/save the pages created with the new editor experience and getting the message "A newer version of this page has been published. Copy any changes you want to keep then edit the page again."

!Confluence_iOS.png|width=194,height=42!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Collaborative editing causing issue in Confluence app on iOS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the switch to application menu, if you have multiple access to other instances/sites, only to one, the name of the instance doesn't show up under the application name/icon.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have access to at least two instances with access to JIRA application
 # Make sure to have access for only one instance with access to Confluence.
# Access the instance
# Click on switch to (application)

h3. Expected Results
You will see the instance's names under the application's name.
h3. Actual Results
The application you have access in only one instance is not showing the name of the instance.


h3. Workaround
Hover on the application's name before clicking on it to see the instance's name.
fields.summary: Switch to menu not showing instance name if user don't have access to multiple instances.

fields.description: Now that opt-out is a thing we can't rely on vanilla feature flags to measure apdex for nav3. We need to add a custom attribute to all the ApdexEnd events so that we can pivot on isNav2
fields.summary: Fix Apdex event for Nav 3

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In Confluence Server, it's possible to generate an Invitation Link which an admin can copy and send directly to the user they want to invite, without having to send via email.

From [Invite people to sign up|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/add-and-invite-users-138313.html#AddandInviteUsers-Invitepeopletosignup]:

# Choose  *> User management*
# Select the *Invite Users* tab
# [...] Copy the Invitation Link and paste it into an email message, or onto a page on your intranet.

This is not possible in Cloud, and the only way is to invite a user via email or allow users to sign themselves up.

h4. Suggestion
Provide a way to generate an Invitation Link without sending an email.
fields.summary: Ability to Generate an Invitation Link

fields.description:
While using the Jira Issue Macro, the issue number limit does not show other issues on the list.
Other issues should also be visible on the page. It would have been helpful if Confluence paginates for every 10 items(or as per the set limit).
 !image-2020-03-09-21-01-40-158.png|thumbnail! 

Ex: Total issues are 20 and the set limit is 5. Then issues should be paginated that 5 issues should be visible at a time.
fields.summary: paginate the list of issues - JIRA Issue Macro
Investigate: Confluence Free won't allow users to post answers on Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In exporting pages to Word, the exported file can't be opened with Pages or LibreOffice

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a page to Word
# Open the exported file using Pages or LibreOffice 

h3. Expected Results
- The exported file should open using Pages or LibreOffice

h3. Actual Results
- The exported file can't be opened  using Pages or LibreOffice 
- Pages will throw a 'Pages couldn’t read the file.'
- LibreOffice will open HTML/XML text file but not the actual content

h3. Workaround
- Use other programs to open the Word file (eg. MS Word)
fields.summary: Exported Word file can't be opened with Pages or LibreOffice

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customers are no longer able to edit and upload new versions of attachments using Atlassian companion app on a network with proxy setup. The file upload step to api.media.atlassian.com fails with ECONNREFUSED. This is consistent with the application attempting a direct connection to api.media.atlassian.com instead of using the network proxy.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Users login to Atlassian Account on a network that has proxy
 # Users go to any Confluence page and attach a Atlassian Companion file like Excel , Word or Wordpad RTF format files
 # They log out then relogin and try to edit this file

h3. Expected Results

The Atlassian companion save the edited file when the file is saved on local desktop
h3. Actual Results

The file keeps loading and is never saved. The below exception is thrown in the companion log file:
{noformat}
.....
{"errno":"ECONNREFUSED","code":"ECONNREFUSED","syscall":"connect","address":"xx.xx.xx.xx","port":xxx},"node":"v12.0.0"},"message":"Error: connect ECONNREFUSED xx.xx.xx.xx:xxx","exception":[{"type":"Error","value":"connect ECONNREFUSED xx.xx.xx.xx:xxx","stacktrace":{"frames":[{"filename":"net.js","lineno":1061,"colno":14,"function":"TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete]","in_app":false,"module":"net"}]}}],"user":{}
...{noformat}
h3. Workaround

On the impacted network - there is no workaround. But using any other network seems to help customer just fine.

*Option 1*
Allow requests to {{https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/asap-public-key-repo.us-west-1.uswest.atl-inf.io}} and {{https://s3.amazonaws.com/asap-public-key-repo.us-east-1.useast.atl-inf.io}} to bypass the proxy. 

*Option 2*
The user can downgrade to Companion 0.6.2 by installing with the MSI (which does not auto update), [download here|https://update-nucleus.atlassian.com/Atlassian-Companion/291cb34fe2296e5fb82b83a04704c9b4/_index/0.6.2/win32/ia32/Atlassian%20Companion-0.6.2.msi]
fields.summary: User on networks with proxy face ECONNREFUSED error when trying to edit via Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we are searching for macros in the *Macro Browser*, there are a couple of sections on the left side of the window. Though, the *Administration* and *Communication* sections don't contain any macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page in the editing mode;
 # Click over  !image-2020-03-06-17-50-50-418.png|width=21,height=18! button and select the *View More* option;
 # At the sidebar of the modal, click on *Administration* or *Communication*.

h3. Expected Results

Some macros related to that topic are shown.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is shown there.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Communication and Administration sections in the Macro Browser are empty

fields.description:
In the new Confluence editor, ``` represents the markdown syntax for a code block.

The swiss-german keyboard layout is a bit special as it has some combinations that are stateful, which come from the fact that it has to support german umlauts (äöü) and french accents. There are keys for the most common ones (èéà) but for all other combinations you have to type ` and then the letter, i.e. ` u.
 * So the keyboard driver "remembers" that you pressed the ` key, but doesn't print the character. If you press it twice, you get two `` printed out directly.

Alternatively you could press ` and space to get a single backtick.
 * In order to get _just_ three backticks you have to press ` 4x + 1 backspace, or ` 3x + space.
 * In markdown however, a lot of interpreters don't care if I enter 3 ``` or 4 ```` so it doesn't matter. But if confluence expects _exactly_ 3 ```, it gets cumbersome to use this syntax.

It'd be nice to bring back the \{macro} syntax (which was very easy, even on the Swiss layout (had to use a combination of AltGr and two keys but which are easily reachable) but sucked on the German layout (AltGr + 7 / 8 - which is very uncomfortable) or a different option for those already using many backticks.
fields.summary: Change Code Block macro keyboard shortcut

fields.description: Enable the Dutch language for content indexing in Confluence
fields.summary: Enable Dutch language for content indexing in Confluence

fields.description:
h4.Summary
Existing lable is missing from the global template while editing the template body content without checking the label.

h4.Environment
Confluence Cloud
h4.Steps to Reproduce
1.Access the global templates admin page (/wiki/pages/templates2/listpagetemplates.action)
2. Edit any template and add a label and save the template.
3. Again edit the template and edit anything in the template body content and save the template.

h4.Expected Results
The Label should be available.

h4.Actual Results
No Label added in the template/lable is missing from the template.

h4.Workaround
Check the lable before Saving the template and edit it again. The label will be shown.
fields.summary: Label is missing from the template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing an existing template that is still on the legacy template editor, it won't be possible to mention users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a template on the legacy template editor
# Try to @mention someone

h3. Expected Results
The list of users should be shown, allowing users to be mentioned. 

h3. Actual Results
* The list of users isn't shown, preventing anyone from being mentioned.
* When trying to use the mention from the macro browser, a "No Macro metadata" message is displayed:
 !metadata.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Create a new template using the new template editor.
fields.summary: Not possible to mention users on legacy templates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if an office document (xlsx, docx, pptx) stored on google drive is linked on  google drive macros (Sheets, Docs, Slides), the macro will still try to open the document but fail to do so without an error.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either prevent the user from linking an office file or display a detailed error.
fields.summary: Suggest of improvement for google drive macros (Sheets, Docs, Slides) error messaging

fields.description:
Perhaps it's in the works to have a user-based-setting (not whole spaces or solution-based) dark mode setting? That would be great. It would mean so much less fatigue and easier focusing on the elements rather than trying to ignore all the gleaming blank white space.

 

Jira needs it too for the same reasons.
fields.summary: Dark Mode, Please

fields.description:
*Feature request summary*: add a macro to Confluence which displays a clock showing the current time in a given timezone.

*Rationale*: Distributed agile teams are very common. Knowing what time it is for your coworker(s) makes it easier for us to collaborate and respect each others work schedules.

*Use case 1*: When creating a Company, Dept, or Team directory/listing in Confluence can include a timezone name (e.g. "EST/EDT" or "ECT" but that doesn't actually help very much. There's business value in knowing what time it _right now_ for each person on our distributed team.

*Use case 2:* A page that is more "dashboard" oriented could contain a set of custom clocks, specific to the timezones relevant for the Company, Dept, Team, etc. We see this often in DevOps and Support teams, yet Confluence cannot do this today.

*MVP features*: a single analog or digital clock would do. The macro would need to have a selector for timezone. A few fixed sizes would be ok.

*Bonus features*: Other clock styles (digital and analog, different designs); color choices; arbitrary sizing.
fields.summary: Macro for timezone-based clocks

fields.description:
Ability to restrict users from adding a new calendar. (Team Calendar)

!image-2020-03-05-16-46-32-961.png!
fields.summary: Ability to restrict 'Add new Calendar'(+ Add Calendar)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* When copying a page, the copied version would not be listed under *Drafts*/*Recently worked on* if you click *Close* without editing the page first.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a page and click *...* on the top right corner > *Copy*;
# Click *Close* instead of publishing the page;
# Navigate back to *Your Work* > *Drafts* (https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/my/drafts/) OR *Recently worked on* (https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work)

h3. Expected Results
* Copied version of the page should be listed under these tabs.

h3. Actual Results
* Copied version is not present under this tab, or any of the recently worked tabs.
 
h3. Note
* This seems to affect especially the old editor

h3. Workaround
* 1st Workaround: Click on the *padlock* right next to the page's name (restrictions)  > add restrictions to the page such as '*viewing & editing restricted*' just to your user > Publish the page - This way the page will be viewable just for your user, and in practicality would be similar to a restricted draft
* 2nd Workaround: Instead of clicking *Close* right away, just edit the copied version with anything (just adding a letter will do), add restrictions to the page such as '*viewing & editing restricted*',  and the page will be listed under *Recently worked on* and *Drafts*
fields.summary: Copied version of page is not listed under Draft or Recently worked on, if the copy hasn't been edited

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the *Attachment Labels* field is set in the attachment macro, all files uploaded to this particular macro will automatically assign that label. Currently, the attachments macro documentation ([here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html] doesn't describe this functionality.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be really appreciated if the documentation described that the attachments uploaded to the specific attachment macro list will contain the labels set on it.
fields.summary: Attachments Macro documentation improvement

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of March 11, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We have released a fix for those who have or may have been affected to get their preferred navigation experience. Hope it helps. In case it still doesn't work, please refresh your Confluence page for the fix to kick in. Thank you for your patience.

Warm regards,

Elaine and the Confluence team
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The side navigation experience stayed after choosing to try the new navigation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # After seeing the modal to opt in/out the new Confluence navigation experience, click on Upgrade to the new navigation experience button.

h3. Expected Results

The UI should be updated to the new navigation experience.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. The UI stays with the old side navigation experience.
h3. Workaround

Affected user can try the following steps to fix the issue:
 * Clear browser local storage (detailed steps will be provided soon)
 * Go to the user profile (avatar) menu at the bottom left (with the side navigation UI)
 * Click the menu item under the NEW NAVIGATION section at the top of the menu. This menu item may read as *Turn off…* click on it anyway to turn on the new experience.

This should get the new navigation experience enabled for you. In case it doesn't, please let us know in the Comments. Thank you.
fields.summary: Couldn't get the new navigation experience after attempting to opt in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the re-order pages from content tools, the changes on the page tree partially propagates on the side-bar page tree and it makes it unclear if they should be synced or not. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

| Create the following page tree |  !original.png|thumbnail! |
| Move one child page from one parent to another. 
Expand the first parent on the sidebar page tree |  !move.png|thumbnail! |


h3. Expected Results

There page trees should sync when changes are performed or a message should be indicate that they are not in sync until the page is refreshed.  

h3. Actual Results

 !move.png|thumbnail! 

On the side bar, the moved child page disappeared from the original parent but it is missing on the destination parent. 


h3. Workaround

Refresh the page when making changes from either the content tools or the side bar page tree.
fields.summary: Sidebar page tree partially updating from re-order pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The font of the included page content increases in size when the side bar is collapsed while in page view mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page as Test 1 and insert table with some content.
 # Create another page Test 2 and add a table on it .
 # Include the page macro for Test 1 to compare the text size.
 # Once published, the font for table on Test 2 and included page will look same.  !image-2020-03-04-17-42-54-413.png|width=261,height=130!
 # Collapse the sidebar and you will see the font in include page macro increases.  !image-2020-03-04-17-48-06-931.png|width=220,height=100!

h3. Expected Results

The font size in include page macro should remain same as original.
h3. Actual Results

The font size in include page macro increases when the sidebar is collapsed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Include page macro content font size increases when sidebar is collapsed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a custom favicon is uploaded in Confluence it's not updated to the new one.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence administration, navigate to *Look and feel* > *Site Logo and Favicon*
 # Upload a custom image in favicon
 # Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

The updated favicon should show up in the sidebar(Logo gets updated)
h3. Actual Results
The favicon is not updated with the latest favicon. Browser console shows *403* error for <site>/wiki/admin/sitelogo/uploadFavicon.action call. 



h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to change favicon in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using android's Confluence app, when trying to open a pdf file through the attachment macro list, it will fail to open the file with an error message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add an attachment macro
# attach a pdf file
# publish the page
# Access the page with Android's mobile app
# Try to open the file

h3. Expected Results
The file should be downloaded/ opened on Android

h3. Actual Results
It tries to open the file but fails with the following error:
"Cannot display PDF (filename.pdf is of invalid format)
 !pdf_error_mobile.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can't open PDF files attached to Attachments macro on Android app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments are not loading when JSD customers tried to access pages directly in Confluence. However, the attachments are loading fine when the JSD customers accessed the page through the JSD portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD Project
 # Add a customer (with Atlassian Account) to the JSD project
 # Create a Confluence space
 # Create a Confluence page and add some attachments on the page
 # Link the JSD Project to the Confluence space
 # Allow "Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledgebase articles with your customers."
 # Ask the customer to access the page directly in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
 * The attachments should be loading properly when JSD customers tried to access linked Confluence pages.

h3. Actual Results

* The attachments are not loading when JSD customers tried to access linked Confluence pages.
h3. Workaround

Link to KB articles in JSD Portal rather than Confluence
fields.summary: Unlicensed users cannot view images in Confluence Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a child page using the "+" icon in the space page tree has a long delay (about 30 seconds).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# navigate to a Confluence Space
# hover the cursor over any page in the page tree
# click the "+" icon to create a child for this page

h3. Expected Results
The pop-up window to create a new page will open immediately.

h3. Actual Results
It takes almost 30 seconds to the pop-up window to open.

h3. Workaround
Click on any link in the page (another page, space settings, ...) to open the create page pop-up.
fields.summary: Creating a child page using the "+" icon in the space page tree has a long delay (about 30 seconds).
Space Import can fail if Inline Tasks doesn't have a valid Creator or if pages doesn't have a Creation date.

fields.description:
I very often create a link to a specific section of a page on a different page.  When I copy and paste the URL, with the anchor link, Confluence modifies it to show the page name, but not the anchor, so it looks like I am referring the user to the whole page, rather than to a very specific section of the page.  

Please add the anchor link to the page name that displays as the link text.
fields.summary: Anchor link text should contain anchor name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro has been edited on the new editor, any additional macro breaks for the page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Add a two dimensional statistics macro with more than 5 rows (y axis) to display 

 !first .png|thumbnail! 

- Add a second two dimensional statistics macro with more than 5 rows (y axis) to display 



h3. Expected Results

The second macro should also be able to display more than 5 rows.

h3. Actual Results

Any additional macro added to the page cannot display the correct number of rows. 

| !second edit.png|thumbnail! |  !second published.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro display breaks in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a page link, the page draft created when clicking on the link is broken. Please see the video attached. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Please see the video below.
 [^bandicam 2020-03-03 12-17-11-883.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The draft should be editable

h3. Actual Results
The page cant be saved and an error is thrown

h3. Workaround
Use the copy of the draft from "recently worked on"
fields.summary: Creating an page link draft fails

DEAR MERLOT,

 

MAY I KNOW IS THERE ANY FUNCTION THAT REPORT OF MAINTENANCE TASK CAN BE GENERATED FROM MERLOT?

 

THANKS.
fields.summary: MAINT REPORT

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user restricts a blog for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the blogpost in a page tree, even though they have access and the page not visible, until they are granted individual restrictions for the page.

This issue is similar  to CONFCLOUD-66969,
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
 # With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for it, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
 # Add group restriction to a blog with the above group.
 # Ask one of the group members to access the above page with the uppercase letter group

h3. Expected Results

The person from the group should be able to view the blogpost in the page tree list.
h3. Actual Results

The person from the group does not see the blog in the Blog page tree
h3. Workaround

Add the user in restriction individually, or add the user to a lowercase group.
fields.summary: Restricted pages do not display in the sidebar/pagetree blog (if they have an uppercase letter group)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Fabric editor no longer sends the `output.type` query parameter to let 3rd-party macros know whether they are being rendered in View or Edit mode.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to Reproduce
Create a dynamic macro
Pass output.type context parameter in the URL
Add the dynamic macro using the new editor
Hit "Save" button in the edit macro dialog


h3. Expected Results
An output.type query parameter is sent with the request


h3. Actual Results
No query parameters are sent to the macro 

h3. Workaround

See CONFCLOUD-65861
fields.summary: Fabric editor does not send output.type query param when fetching macro content

fields.description: Depending on the use case, customers would like to be able to add a report on a page that displays the row count of a specific table.
fields.summary: Table row count report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Input is sometimes broken and gets looped when using the old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a page that is made using the old editor
# Click the pencil icon to edit
# Start editing
# Reload the editor until you see the multiple avatars of yourself
# Type something (any of ASCII or multibyte text)

h3. Expected Results
User is able to edit

h3. Actual Results
The input text is getting looped forever
 [^bug.mov] 
 
h3. Workaround
* reload the page
* change the locale to "English(US)" by
## navigate to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
## update the language setting to "English(US)"
## wait for 5 minutes and reload the Confluence page
fields.summary: Input text loop when using the old editor
Update Atlassian Renderer Library to use HtmlSafeAnnotationBoxingUberspec

fields.description:
Hi. I don't know if this issue has been raised, but that extra trigger for the data-testid="ContextualNavigation" pane is rather disruptive. There are already two other better ways of opening that nav pane: the ak-nav aria expand toggle button thing, and the brace key "[".

[https://belamiinc-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/p/matthew_lewis/EVi96avKUD1Mim4oPeRiPscBSXcHF-A_DfC1GQOJ_tgG_A]

 

When trying to compare versions on a page, the checkboxes are close enough to that nav pane that it pops out eclipsing the boxes I'm trying to get to. These types of things (some of your toastr additions) just get in the way of the objects I'm going for. It looks like maybe you're just testing that out but just wanted to suggest _not_ making this feature into a thing that you feature.

 

Thanks. That's all.
fields.summary: ContextualNavigation is pops out too easily
